newsitem.title: FRANCE: French stocks close down on profit-taking.
newsitem.headline: French stocks close down on profit-taking.

text.p: French stocks closed lower on Monday after the French market tracked an early decline on Wall Street due to profit-taking.
The blue-chip CAC-40 index finished down 19 points, or 0.78 percent, at 2,406.10 after giving up an early advance that lifted it an all-time intraday high of 2,438.50 points earlier.
The CAC-40 January futures contract fell 17 points to 2,412.
"It's normal for the market to pause for breath," said a trader. The CAC index set four closing records last week.
Brokers said the bourse will probably trade cautiously ahead of U.S. Federal Reserve chairman Alan Greenspan's testimony on Tuesday before the U.S. Senate.
They said Merrill Lynch had concluded that the Paris bourse was correctly valued now after catching up with other stockmarkets, and this judgment had a dampening effect.
Monday's volume was a heavy 6.5 billion francs.
Shares in oil firm Elf Aquitaine rose 1.96 percent to 520 francs, helped by the dollar's gains and an upgrade on the stock by U.S. investment firm Goldman Sachs.

Eurotunnel shares closed up 5.8 percent at 7.30 francs after the Channel Tunnel operator reported a rise in passengers to 13 million in 1996 and said it hoped to finish negotiating details of a bank debt accord by March.

Shares in bank Credit Foncier slipped 0.16 percent to 63 francs. The chairman declared himself a hostage on Monday and broke off talks with unions as a staff siege at the troubled bank's headquarters dragged into a fourth day.
